title: How to Make Starry and Beady Glue

steps.headline: Prepare all the things you need.
Decide if you want to make a colored glue.
steps.description: If you want colored glue, use some water-based marker or any marker as long as it is not whiteboard and permanent markers then it's fine. Food dye can also be used.

steps.headline: Pour as much glue as you want inside the cup.
Add beads and sparkly stars into the mixture.
Squeeze out some ink or food dye into the mixture if you want colored glue.
Stir until everything is evenly distributed.
Pour the mixture into bag.
steps.description: Some may even opt to skip mixing in a cup and just pour everything straight away in the bag and shake the mixture together - this is possible, but may be a little trickier to get a smooth and even mix.

steps.headline: Tie the top and cut a small hole at one bottom corner of the bag.
Start using the glue!
steps.description: To use, press the glue to the hole!

text: Prepare all the things you need.  Decide if you want to make a colored glue. If you want colored glue, use some water-based marker or any marker as long as it is not whiteboard and permanent markers then it's fine. Food dye can also be used. Pour as much glue as you want inside the cup.  Add beads and sparkly stars into the mixture.  Squeeze out some ink or food dye into the mixture if you want colored glue.  Stir until everything is evenly distributed.  Pour the mixture into bag. Some may even opt to skip mixing in a cup and just pour everything straight away in the bag and shake the mixture together - this is possible, but may be a little trickier to get a smooth and even mix. Tie the top and cut a small hole at one bottom corner of the bag.  Start using the glue! To use, press the glue to the hole!
